summary: You stand at the Entrance: the foreboding gateway to the ghastly dungeon, eerily guarded by ancient, sullen stone gargoyles.
detail: As you hesitantly step across the worn threshold, a shivering chill dances across your spine. Your heart-rate stirs as you gaze upon a desolate Entrance: long forsaken by the living. Perched atop their lofty perches, weathered stone gargoyles leer down upon you, sizing you up with their lifeless, malicious gaze. The dense clutches of grit and grime obscure a clandestine message, etched into the very slabs: here lies the Portal to the damned.

expression.content: A bottle of Holy Water lies neglected at your feet. Perhaps armaments against the effects of malevolence, or defenses discarded in tearful screams; either way, you realize you must descend downward, for the true horrors reveal themselves deep within the shadows.

Upon closer inspection, you notice the stone gargoyles seem meticulously well-defined, an otherworldly pride raging behind their deadened eyes. In ways inexplicable, these guardians resonate horrific timelessness stowed in their intent gaze. You swiftly step back, an inadvertent shiver seizing your core.

You diligently decipher the ancient text, feeling faint whispers of the forgotten echo around you. A palpable animosity crawls across your galvanended skin as the verse of peril unfurls before you: 'Venture forth, brave souls with agendas awry; beware, for evils who lay dormant shall arise.

expressions.content: As you grasp the bottle and nervously clutch it to your aching heart, a comforting blaze infiltrates your braving spirit.
